Frame.Nav: Window washers are standard on front and side windows.
Steps provide quick access to engine under electric hood.
Field-proven Cummins engine delivers 248 to 286 net HP.
Lexan lenses protect headlights.
Rear-window protective screen keeps wayward payload from damaging window.
Heaped capacity ranges from Case 325 and 330 ranges from 17.4 to 20.9 cubic yards.
Electric hood raises 90 degrees to provide quick access to the power plant.
Cab provides the outstanding all-around visibility on the job site.
Front and rear halogen floodlights are standard for job site visibility.
A heavy-duty frame with steel castings provides longer operating life and trouble-free operation.
Groung-level service doors provide easy access to batteries and washer fluid.
Ground level gauges allow easy check of fuel and hydraulic levels.
The drive line is lubed for life.
Tire options are available to match job-site conditions.
Dump body tips 67 degrees for clean payload dumping.
Swing-out fenders provide quick access to major power components.
Spacious cab includes standard six-way suspension seat for comfort.
Two master zert locations provide grease to front and rear chassis.
Proven ZF limited-slip axles are standard with differential lock for difficult ground conditions.
A wide body provides for maximum payload.
Rear television camera is standard for enhanced visibility.
Rugged ZF transmission has power shift with torque converter.
Exclusive reflective decals provide added visibility on the job site.
Optional remote-control electric heated mirrors are available.
Sloping hood enhances visibility.
A wider frame allows the multi-stage telescopic lift cylinders to be mounted inside the frame for increased stability.
The truck articulates 45 degrees, and an oscillation joint helps the truck traverse uneven or adverse terrain.
Rocking-beam rear suspension has fewer parts to wear out as it cushions the load.
The differential lock system allows the operator to select from three options to best match ground conditions for the best ride.
